title: Commonplace Book
synopsis: Commonplace books were originally the preserve of male scholars who used them to keep notes as they learned; but gradually their use spread beyond universities and by the 18th century commonplace books were also used by educated women. The problem wasn't in the collecting, but the finding again. Kathryn Kane writes about English cultural history in the Regency period covered the development of the commonplace book quite thoroughly. [http://regencyredingote.wordpress.com/2013/11/22/salads-of-many-herbs-zibaldone-in-the-regency/ link]

title: Disorientation in Hypertext
synopsis: Disorientation in hypertext: the effects of three text structures on navigation performance. Sharon McDonald, Rosemary J. Stevenson. 1996. A study examines the effects of two hypertext topologies (hierarchy and non-linear) on navigation performance compared to a linear version of the same document. ... The results showed that subjects performed better with the linear text than with the non-linear text, while performance on the hierarchical document fell between these two extremes.  [https://www.interruptions.net/literature/McDonald-ApplErgon96.pdf pdf]

title: Eric Dobbs
synopsis: A tangle of ideas have continually resurfaced in my attention over the past couple decades. With this wiki, I seek to share my notes as I continue to explore the tangles.

title: Explore
synopsis: Explore. Charter an exploration. Make note of surprises along the way.

title: Explore It!
synopsis: Exploratory testing compliments TDD and other test automation.  Especially interested in the structured exploration to guide learning.  [https://pragprog.com/book/ehxta/explore-it book]

title: Incremental Pages
synopsis: A wiki buds new pages as the need for them emerges. At this point in creation we challenge our future selves to thoughts beyond our immediate needs else the new remains only a footnote to the old.

title: Incremental Paragraphs
synopsis: A complete thought is more important than a complete sentence. Write to be read in progress. Expect your work to be consumed and discarded before it is finished.

title: Too Many Displays
synopsis: Our charter is to explore Chapter 26 of the Handbook of Human-Computer Interaction, 2nd Edition: How Not to have to Navigate Through Too Many Displays. We will bring our wealth of experience with software and hypermedia to compare with the experience and research of thoughtful authors. We hope to discover insight that informs our application of hypermedia here in wiki.

title: Visual Momentum
synopsis: Visual momentum: a concept to improve the cognitive coupling of person and computer. David D Woods. 1984. [http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/S0020-7373(84)80043-7 doi] [https://www.researchgate.net/publication/222737388_Visual_Momentum_A_Concept_to_Improve_the_Cognitive_Coupling_of_Person_and_Computer researchgate]

title: Welcome Visitors
synopsis: Welcome to this [[Federated Wiki]] site. From this page you can find who we are and what we do. New sites provide this information and then claim the site as their own. You will need your own site to participate.
